terms.definition:
is a settlement event card found in the Pinups of Death 1 white box expansion.

Card Text.
The survivors discover a man-sized patch of darkness of the outskirts of the settlement. Their lanterns flicker and dim as they approach it. Choose a returning survivor to investigate the strange spot and roll 1d10.

Notes.
The artwork for this event features the starting survivors - Allister, Erza, and Lucy reacting to a gender swapped Zachary.

is a piece of gear with the Accessory special rule.]]
A gear special rule. Accessory gear may be worn in addition to armor on a hit location. Each accessory specifies the hit location it covers. As long as accessories are all different, a survivor may equip as many of them as they wish to a single hit location. Wearing a Forsaker Mask on top of a Lion Headdress on top of a White Lion Helm is perfectly acceptable.

See Also.
List of Accessories.

is a settlement event card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.
Card Text.
The air tastes sour and burns the survivors' cracked lips.
The sky cracks in great flashes, revealing spiraling black clouds.
Finally it opens, dousing everything in acid rain.
Roll 1d10.

Lingering Effects.
The storm prevents Music endeavors.
The storm inspires. +2 to the result of all Art endeavors.

Acid Storm Exercise - roll 1d10.
 Requires Nightmare Training

Acid Storm Distillation - roll 1d10.
 Requires Cooking
A gear special rule. You may activate this up to X times per showdown (use tokens to track).

is a gear card that has an affinity bonus special rule.]]
A type of gear special rule. Having the indicated number of colored affinities will trigger the effect. Each affinity bonus only applies once, regardless of how many extra affinities a survivor has.

See Also.
Prismatic
Puzzle Affinity

Afterdeath Brew is a pattern gear card found in the Oktoberfest Aya holiday white box expansion.

Card Text.
You consume this and gain 5 bleeding tokens.

During the Aftermath, roll 1d10 for each survivor that died from bleeding tokens. On a 9+, the brew saves their life but makes them deaf.

Crafting Requirements.
In order to obtain Afterdeath Brew, survivors must complete the requirements found on the Afterdeath Brew pattern card.

is an advanced Phoenix AI card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Roll 1d10. On a result of 6+, a random survivor in the blind spot is Pulled In.

Pulled In: Remove the survivor from the showdown board. Spend all their age tokens on the table. If they survive, place the survivor adjacent to the monster at the start of the next monster turn.

is a rare gear card found in the Easter Aya pinup white box expansion.

Card Text.
When you are picked as a target while insane, the carrot shrieks fearfully. Roll 1d10. On a 1, the shrill sound stuns you. You are doomed for the rest of the monster's action. On a 6+, the harsh note alerts you. Ignore the first hit of the monster's attack.

How to Obtain.
During Black Harvest, if the Gatherer is insane, they follow a shrill echo in the darkness. A fleshy stalk quivers in the ground, its muffled shrieking begs to be uprooted. Gain the Ancient Root rare gear.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
Mighty winds tear across the landscape, collecting chips of stones and skeletal remains. The survivors huddle together on the outskirts of the storm. They may either brave the storm or wait it out.

Brave the storm: all survivors gain +1 courage and suffer 1 event damage to 3 random hit locations. Archive all fragile gear.

Wait it out: roll twice on the hunt event table before moving on the hunt board.

Cancer Pigeons is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
The survivors are surrounded by the echoing coo of infant babble. Strange baby-faced birds circle overhead. Gripped with instinctual horror, the survivors break into a run!

Each survivor rolls 1d10. The lowest scoring survivor (or survivors, in case of ties) becomes a straggler. If any survivor has noisy gear, -2 to their roll. Each straggler rolls 1d10.

If any survivor has a whip, they crack it, scattering many of the birds. Each straggler adds +4 to their roll.

If any survivor has a whip, a hasty tether is made. Add +4 to your roll.

is a story event found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion rulebook.

Lore.
Perfectly formed bodies bulging with muscle. Massive eyes capable of seeing in the darkness. A menacing gleam of stark white teeth set in a rictus grin.Gambler's Chest Expansion, Rulebook, page 125

Victory.
+1 Hunt XP
+1 Weapon Proficiency Level (if eligible)
+Rewards

Defeat.
The Bone Eaters revel in their power. Archive all gear with the bone keyword. They expertly skin the survivors and use the pale scraps to bundle their bones. All that remains is a neat pile of organs and viscera. Redraw any bone resources gained from Cannibalize.

Rewards.
The Bone Eater corpses petrify. Roll 1d10 for each Bone Eater defeated. On a 7+, the survivors manage to carve a random basic resource from its body.

On a 10+, a survivor pries a Royal Scalpel rare gear free from a dying Bone Eater in time before its petrified grip makes it impossible. Limit once per campaign.

The group gains the following rewards:

Deliberate.
Survivors may choose to resume the hunt, return home (suffer Starvation), or reduce the level of the quarry by 1 (all survivors lose 1 survival and suffer 1 brain damage).

Settlements with Song of the Brave cannot change the quarry's level or turn back. Instead, survivors gain +3 survival and continue on singing.

Ways to trigger.

References.

A storm sweeps over the survivors. Deep purple lightning flashes overhead. The bolts freeze in mid-strike and rain down on the survivors as jagged, glowing spikes. Each survivor rolls 1d10. The lowest scoring survivor (or survivors, in case of ties) becomes a straggler.

A bolt crashes beside the straggler, catching them in an explosion of razor-sharp crystals. They suffer 1d5 event damage to 2 random hit locations. Archive all fragile gear in their gear grid.

Event Text.
The survivors rush forward, feeling their quarry close at hand. Skip the next hunt space. If this movement begins the showdown, the survivors ambush their quarry. If any survivor has noisy gear, the survivors do not ambush. Start the showdown normally.

A gear special rule. This completes an armor set if you're wearing the rest of the set and it shares a material keyword with the missing armor gear. For example, if you're wearing an Oxidized Lantern Helm and Phoenix Armor on every other hit location, you would gain the Phoenix Armor set bonus because the Phoenix Helm also has the metal keyword.

List of Outfits.

A gear special rule. Paired weapons are two identical weapons that can be used as one. Add the speed of the second weapon when attacking with the first. These weapons must have the same name, and both must be in your gear grid.

List of Paired Weapons.

An attack dice roll result of a Lantern 10. This always results in a hit. When there are multiple Perfect Hits in a single attack, trigger any rules applying to Perfect Hits that many times.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
The survivors encounter a group of fleeing settlers. If the settlement has Symposium and Language, the survivors manage to crudely communicate. The survivors may offer a resource or gear to help the distressed refugees.

If they do, archive the offering. The refugees frantically share their mournful tale. While much is lost in translation, they relate the savage invasion of a monster that destroyed their home. The tale prepares the survivors for what lies ahead. At the start of the showdown, reveal the top 5 AI cards of the AI deck and put them back in any order. If any survivor has the Leader fighting art, one of the settlers is drawn to their charisma. Gain +1 population.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
The ground ahead is pockmarked with pools filled with a gooey liquid. They bubble merrily and stink of digesting meat. As the survivors move between them, they are overcome by waves of nausea.

If any survivor has a sickle, they slice a few leaves from a nearby plant and everybody uses them to plug their noses and mask the smell. All survivors gain +1 understanding.

Otherwise, each survivor rolls 1d10. If the result is less than their survival, they continue on. Otherwise, they vomit into a nearby pool, suffering 1 event damage to the body. Before their eyes, the pool greedily dissolves their vomit, they gain +1 understanding.

If any survivor has 3+ understanding, they devise a way to use the pools. Each survivor may place one piece of gear in the pool. Archive the gear and gain the resources used to craft it (if any).

A gear special rule. Sealed gear has a bonus effect that can only be earned by training. A survivor can unseal the gear by declaring it as their weapon proficiency, forsaking the normal bonuses of selecting a weapon type. When the survivor reaches the specialization rank, they earn the effect listed after the Sealed special rule on the gear card. A survivor can only earn a gear's Sealed bonus once per lifetime. 

Example: A survivor declares Toxicimitar as their weapon proficiency (because it has a Sealed effect). When they reach rank 3 (specialization), they gain the Crescent Step secret fighting art.

is a story event for in the Gorm Expansion rulebook.

Lore.
"One day, great woe fell upon the settlement. Unrelenting storms raged overhead. Out of the squall, a giant beast came to gobble up the strongest and most beautiful, then wandered back into the darkness with a lonesome cry, searching for a mate." Kingdom Death: Monster, Gorm Expansion Rulebook, page 9

Aftermath.
Victory.
+1 Hunt XP
+1 Weapon Proficiency Level (if eligible)
+Rewards

Rewards.
The first time the Gorm is defeated, add Gormery and Gormchymist to the settlement locations. If they have not innovated it yet, the settlement gains the Nigredo innovation.

The group gains the following rewards:

Level 1
4 basic resources 
4 Gorm resources
Level 2
4 basic resources 
6 Gorm resources
Level 3
4 basic resources 
8 Gorm resources
1 Stomach Lining strange resource

If the settlement innovated Song of the Brave when they defeat Gorm, they compose a formidable song filled with wild cries to ward off the mating Gorm herds from the settlement's vicinity. Remove Gorm Climate from the next lantern year on the timeline. 

Defeat.
The Gorm roots through the bodies, devouring whatever it can from the remains. Archive all consumable gear from the deceased survivors' grids.

There once was a beast that wanted to feel how soft its fur was. Since it could not reach its own back, it killed many other creatures and spent time rubbing its paws over them. is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
A rumpled, unsightly bird stands in the survivor's path. Its beady, wet eyes blink expectantly and it calls out with an eerie human chuckle. The survivors may archive 1 consumable item or gear, offering it to the trollbird. If any survivor is insane, they must feed the trollbird, if able. If they feed the trollbird, it hops off with a terrible cackle.

If they don't feed the trollbird, it follows the survivors on their hunt, constantly mocking them with its chuckle. Roll 1d10. If any survivor has the Coprolalia disorder, they curse at the bird and make vigorous and vulgar gestures. The bird is impressed. Add 3+ to your roll.

is a story event in the Dung Beetle Knight Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
The settlement laboriously works the ground. Prepare the Farm. In addition, you may Encase & Bury Gear.

Prepare the Farm.
Nominate 1 or more survivors to be Farmers. A survivor cannot be a Farmer if they have already endeavored elsewhere this settlement phase. All Farmers toil underground, pulling nightmare weeds and fighting seed eating insects.

The Farmers are exhausted by their task. They cannot depart or spend endeavors this settlement phase. Roll 1d10, adding the number of Farmers to the result.

Encase & Bury Gear.
Nominate 1 or more survivors to be Embalmers. A survivor cannot be an Embalmer if they have already endeavored elsewhere this settlement phase. The Embalmers carefully construct casings and bury gear deep in mineral-rich soil.

The Embalmers are exhausted by their task. They cannot depart or spend endeavors this settlement phase.

For each Embalmer, select 1 gear with the mineral keyword and spend 1 Preserved Caustic Dung strange resource. For each piece of gear selected, roll 1d10.

Bury the Gear.
The gear has been expertly buried. Indicate this on the settlement storage and archive the gear. Gear may be recovered during the Black Harvest story event.
